author: jsign
content:
Looks like you'd be getting that for free whenever you deserialize a point in G1/G2.
That JS library is using these bindings from a C++ codebase https://github.com/Chia-Network/bls-signatures/tree/main/js-bindings
And in the deserialization logic, it does a if the point is a valid point in the subgroup: https://github.com/Chia-Network/bls-signatures/blob/main/src/elements.cpp#L23-L27
Probably if you avoid any API reg deserialization that is suffixed with `XXXUnchecked(...)`, you'll be fine.
(Warn: I don't have a clue about this library, just did a skim now)

author: jsign
content:
Under that logic, seems like:
```
 var g1 = BLS.G1Element.from_bytes(g1Bytes);
 var g2 = BLS.G2Element.from_bytes(g2Bytes);
```
would do the check automatically, and fail otherwise.
(I don't know much about JS... maybe error handling is done with exceptions? (sad!))
